page.title: 02Kirdford Parish Church.
page.content: Kirdford Church is called St John The Baptist.Part of it is Norman.The latest part was built in the fifteenth century.The Church organ was made in Victorian times.The tower is about hundred feet high and has 108 steps leading up to it.The six bells were made in the sixteenth century. Todays vicar is the Reverend M.Cochlin. Fifty-one vicars have worked in the church since 1308. On average three services are held a week called Holy Communion,Parish Communion and Evensong. The average people attending the services is 45. The 692 grave stones stand in an area of 3.5 acres. There are seven beautiful stained glass windows some of these made of locally made glass.
